Groups.Group: Internet Security Benchmarks + Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Level 1

Advanced.DetectScript: #!/bin/bash RV=0 servicename="tftp-server" reason="The $servicename is not removed" rpm -q $servicename &>/dev/null if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then RV=1 fi if [ $RV -eq 1 ]; then echo "${reason}" >&1 echo "The $servicename should be removed" >&2 fi exit $RV

Vulnerability.Title: Remove tftp-server
Vulnerability.Description:
Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) is a simple file transfer protocol, typically used to automatically transfer configuration or boot machines from a boot server. The package tftp-server is the server package used to define and support a TFTP server.
Note: This content will only provide detection of the security threat or vulnerability. Remediation must be performed manually.
